post_text: Starting on Monday, June 22nd, our public access to the track, tennis courts and stadium will be closed. We apologize for any inconvenience this will create for our runners, walkers, and tennis players; however, there will be construction work occurring behind the high school and in the immediate vicinity of these areas. We are excited that next school year we will have new tennis courts, a new paved path to the West side of the football stadium, and additional handicapped parking spaces. In order to maintain the safety of all involved during the construction, we are asking the public to avoid the back of the high school as the construction work is being completed. Again, we apologize for the inconvenience, and hope you can use Culp Lane Park instead while we work to complete our summer construction work. Thank you for your patience with us and once the work is complete we will open our facilities back up for public use.

It is time to recognize our Young Authors county and state-level winners.

The Young Authors program is designed to help teachers encourage and improve students’ abilities in writing, reading, listening, and sharing, and to recognize the accomplishments of our young writers.
